page.title: 03ASHPERTON SCHOOL
page.content: Ashperton School, built in 1854, is a co-educational school for children aged 5-11yrs. The school has a wide catchment area which includes places like Putley, Canon Frome and Newtown Cross. There are three classes; Infant, Lower Junior, Upper Junior which cater for about 75 children. The infant classroom is used for assemblies as the school does not possess a hall. P.E. apparatus lessons take place at Bosbury Primary School and swimming tuition at the Ledbury Baths. The Entrance Hall has a library of reference books. Other equipment and aids are kept in the resource room. A Terrapin classroom has recently been built to replace the old H.O.R.S.A. classroom. Each year the P.T.A. holds a Fete to raise funds for the school.
